result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E. Nemitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael E. Nemitz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael E. Nemitz was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Seek/maintain full time employment unless in treatment or seek work as required by agent.

Defendant has 158 days credit if probation revoked.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  AODA/treatment.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Not to go to taverns/bars or business where primary purpose of business is sale of alcohol or drug paraphernalia.  No association w/people under the influence of intoxicating substances of any kind.  Absolute Sobriety of alcohol & controlled substances.  Random UAs.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael E. Nemitz in court with attorney Derek Horkan.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Ryan states matter is resolved.  Atty Horkan states recommendations.  State agrees.  Atty Horkan enters NC plea.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Horkan makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  DE advised of voting rights, appeal rights and felony firearm warnings.

Ct 1:  NC - w/o second or subsequest
3 years probation
Conditions of probation:
$268.00 costs and $250.00 DNA surcharges to be paid per agent (cash bond to be applied)
DNA sample to be provided (unless one has previously been provided
AODA/Follow-up treatment
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances unless there is a valid prescription
If prescription is received the agent must be notified w/in two working days
Random UA's per agent
Not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores or any business that sells drug paraphernalia
No association w/people under the influence of intoxicating substances of any kind
Seek/maintain full-time employment unless in treatment or seek work as required by agent
Any other rules, regulations, conditions and treatment as imposed by agent
158 days sentence credit ordered if probation should be revoked
Ct 2:  Dismissed

Defendant Michael E. Nemitz in court with attorney Derek Horkan.  Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Horkan gives status.  Matter is set for sentencing, however waiver of preliminary hearing today.  Defendant agrees and understands.    Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-13-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Michael E. Nemitz in court with attorney Derek Horkan.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states case and appearances.  Bond modification stipulated to today at $500.00 cash bond w/previously ordered conditions.  Atty Horkan agrees and has filed an amended $500 cash bond w/no possession of controlled substances.

Defendant Michael E. Nemitz appeared by video means with Attorney Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is represented by Derek Horkan.  Defendant did also receive public defender information.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request $5000.00 cash w/ conditions.  Attorney Steinman notes defendant is on a probation hold.  Time limits waived. $5000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of controlled substances w/out a valid Rx.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
